lines.text: [Frank claims he shot Alvarado in self-defense]
Rustler?
Suspicion of. Tried to kill me with this.
What happened then?
Guess.
Tried to dry gulch ya?
Nope. Face to face showdown.
He jumped you first?
Mm-hmm.

[dubious]
Self-defense, huh?
Yessir! Self defense.
You don't believe me, is that it? Is that why you sent Bill out?
When a man is killed in this district, it's my job to investigate - even when the killer happens to be one of my deputies.
I don't like that word 'killer'!
It's not a pleasant word, but when one man kills another, that is the term.

I've seen gunplay all my life, Frank. I came west out of St. Joe on a wagon train in '51; I was just a kid. I knew Bridger and Hickok and Bat Masterson, Shotgun Thompson and a lot of others. It was coyote and Kiowa in those days. It was rough and tough and a man had to be the same to last. But the cattlemen have got to learn that they can't go cuttin' farmers' fences and the settlers have got to learn that they can't bushwhack a line rider without answerin' to the law! The hogleg is on its way out, the law's comin' in; this thing will end up in a museum.
Whaddya find?
Oh, very interesting.
Speaking how - as undertaker or coroner.
Both. As coroner, I'd say he was shot from high up, like Deputy Smeed was on horseback or Carlos was crouched when he came a-shootin'.
And as undertaker?
Ah, he'll look fine! Great subject - fine features. A little palmaid on the hair, a little color on the cheeks - Carlos Alvarado will be a picture.
I never carry a gun myself. Just a couple of cigars - settles any argument.
Next of kin?
Conchita.
Con... Every other Spanish girl in town is named Conchita.
And every other one is called Lupe. Conchita sings at the cantina.
A baby comes into the world a howlin' and a bellowin'. A man ought to go out in style and dignity, proper-like.
You're strangers, aren't you. Are you from Texas?
Never ask a man if he's from Texas.
If he ain't, why make him feel bad?
What the heck kind of fandango was that?
You know, Texas had to petition four times to get herself taken into the United States. Why did Congress ever give in? Why?
We got a message for you.
More important than a message - an order.
A very important order from a very important figure hereabouts. When he whispers, people take it for shoutin'.
The boss of the T-Lazy-W wants to palaver with ya.
Mr. Thorton Wills - at the main ranch house.
I don't know him. Never had any business with him.
You have now, Johnny Law.
Trot, don't mosey.
Alright, let's go.
We'd like to know the charge.
illegal entry, assault and battery, suspicion of burglary and resisting arrest.
Form your squares, folks. How about that old dosey-doe hoedown? All set, boys? Everybody in your places, straighten up your faces, tighten up your traces, we're in for a long pull!
You want to file a complaint?
With you personally, not your office.
I ain't interested in your ruckus with Alvarado, nor particularly interested he ain't among the livin'. I don't even care who's got the cash, just so's I get it back.

No, I ain't accusin' you of a thing. If you feel guilty, edgy, that's your lookout. You might just know who took it, you might be able to just find it. I want it back. I aim to get it back if it costs ten times as much.
I don't know anything about it.
If that's the way you want it. You've had a fair shake.
I am shepherd of my savage sheep, Bill. I assure you Nachez is not missing.
Well, you look fit to be tied, Bill.
You know those two burglars are out on bail and you know who went to the judge and paid it? That Indian agent!
Wellll, Mr. Charleton's feedin' off his range.
I'm a little mixed up, Mr. Forrester. What's brewing?
Eh, it's too soon to tell. It could be coffee, tea... maybe arrow poisoning. We'll just have to sit back and let it boil until it boils over - and then we'll see what's in the pot.
Mr. Alvarado's death seems to be much more important than his life ever was.
Bill - please, dear, if you have to shoot, shoot first. I want you, not a memory.
[startled, Frank reaches for his gun]
Howdy, Frank.
Oh. Howdy, Bill.
Kinda edgy aren't you?
Well, I-I thought you were Nachez. I had him, but he got away.
Uh-huh. You sent his horse home. Does that mean he won't need it anymore?
Hide me out. Cover for me!
That doesn't come within my duties and perogatives as Indian agent.
Looking for one of my deputies, Frank Smeed... seemed to be heading in this direction. Have you seen him?
What kind of a price is on his head? I'm sorry, Mr. Marshal - bad joke. One mustn't joke about politics, religion or police matters. No, I haven't seen Frank around.
I'd be obliged if he comes by this way to tell him I want to see him to clear up a case.
I will, sir. Nothing happens within my domain that I don't know about.
Has Bill Gentry been by?
You seem to have lost your entire department, Marshal.
I hate to see a human being helpless. Of course, it does have it's advantages. Just give me $4000 and we can procede.
